Potential diagram of quartz crystal under 2 MPa of pressure and 5000
The ANSYS simulation results showthat quartz crystal had an obvious potential difference output
under the action of acceleration signals. The relationship between electric potential difference and
charge is shown in Equations (8) and (9) [
static acceleration. In general, the output increased with the acceleration
signal increase. For the same acceleration amplitude, the output charge of the dynamic load was
generally larger than that of the static load. For example, the output charge was 9.4
static acceleration signal action, while that of 1000
C. Actually, the quartz crystal of piezoelectric pressure sensor was usually thicker than the
ANSYS model, which produced a more signiﬁcant acceleration-induced effect.
The key of establishing a reliable dynamic mathematical model to describe acceleration- induced
effects of pressure sensor is the accurate experimental data. As a common excitation device, a Machete
hammer is able to generate a half-sinusoidal acceleration signal with a near millisecond pulse width,
which reliably guarantees the transient of the pressure signals [
